title: selfencrypting solid state drives SSD
extract: Self-Encrypting Drives. From ArchWiki. Hardware-based full-disk encryption (FDE) is now available from many hard disk (HDD) vendors, becoming increasingly common especially for solid state drives. The term "Self-Encrypting Drive" (SED) is now common when referring to HDDs / SSDs with built-in full-disk encryption (FDE) ...Nov 22, 2018
extract_html: Self-Encrypting Drives. From ArchWiki. The term "Self-Encrypting Drive" (SED) is now common when referring to HDDs / SSDs with built-in full-disk encryption (FDE) ...Nov 22, 2018
